name: Michael Cognetti
title: Partner
credentials: J.D., Villanova University Charles Widger School of Law, 2000
B.S., Construction Management, Penn State University, 1997
Licensed in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and Delaware
bio: Michael Cognetti brings a unique combination of construction industry experience and legal expertise to complex construction and commercial litigation matters. With a degree in construction management from Penn State and over 25 years of legal experience, Michael understands both the technical and legal aspects of construction projects. He represents contractors, subcontractors, developers, and property owners in construction disputes, contract negotiations, and regulatory compliance matters. Michael's practice includes construction defect claims, delay and impact claims, mechanic's liens, and payment disputes. He is certified in construction law and maintains active membership in the Associated General Contractors, keeping him current on industry trends and best practices. His practical understanding of construction processes and project management allows him to effectively advocate for clients in complex multi-party construction litigation. Michael regularly handles matters involving public works projects, design-build contracts, and green building standards.
